intro: Bupleurum baldense subsp. gussonei, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe, particularly Sicily. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, arranged in compound umbels, and bloom from spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other Bupleurum species.
